body: Which distro do you run? This is a crash due to fontconfig in one of our dependencies, I'd assume you maybe have your fontconfig configuration in a strange location?

issue.title: Crash when loading fontconfig

repository.name: client-toolkit
repository.description: Smithay's toolkit for writing wayland clients

issue.body:
This has been reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/4591.

Generally the fontconfig of sctk should probably be reworked, but even if it doesn't it should under no circumstances just prevent the entire application from working. An unwrap in sctk on something that can actually occur seems rather inappropriate.

body:
I'm running Clear Linux on the kernel-native branch and I installed fontconfig through the package manager swupd.

- swupd definition for fontconfig package: https://github.com/clearlinux/clr-bundles/blob/master/bundles/devpkg-fontconfig

It looks like my fonts.conf is in `/usr/share/defaults/fonts/fonts.conf`. When I peeked at it in vim, Syntastic complains about line 2: `|2 error| warning: failed to load external entity "/usr/share/defaults/fonts/fonts.dtd"`. And sure enough, that file doesn't exist.

- [Screenshot of syntastic error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43632885/102654201-021d4480-4125-11eb-8363-22a202786a3c.png)
- `tree` on `/usr/share/defaults/fonts` and `/usr/share/fontconfig`: https://gist.github.com/catleeball/7df795ab0a2522c0662dfce59214034e
- contents of fonts.conf: https://gist.github.com/catleeball/90bf749640d2390329b0ff095d085c85
- contents of 42-clear.conf: https://gist.github.com/catleeball/8a2089bfa87ba73f97cb5341d630717f

I'm about to head out the door, but later I can try symlinking these configs to some of the standard directories at the top of [the font-config docs](https://www.freedesktop.org/software/fontconfig/fontconfig-user.html), or pass ./configure some paths or something.

Let me know if you have suggestions or need more info! Thanks!

I haven't done a whole lot more troubleshooting than before, but I made a symlink to `/usr/share/defaults/fonts/fonts.conf` in /etc/fonts/font.config, Alacritty was able to launch.

However, putting a symlink to fonts.conf in `$HOME/.local/share/fonts.conf` or `$HOME/.local/share/fonts/fonts.conf` or `/usr/local/share/fonts.conf` doesn't work, same panic.

My `$XDG_DATA_DIRS` is set to `/home/cat/.local/share/flatpak/exports/share:/var/lib/flatpak/exports/share:/usr/local/share:/usr/share`, but unsetting it temporarily didn't seem to help either.

I'm curious if [this line](https://github.com/Smithay/andrew/blob/master/src/text/fontconfig.rs#L13) in the [andrew crate](https://github.com/Smithay/andrew) isn't working as the author intended, but I need to test it out. I might file a bug in the andrew repo if I can confirm it.

issue.title: Ready for Review: Fix font-config crash

repository.name: client-toolkit
repository.description: Smithay's toolkit for writing wayland clients

issue.title: Fix Wayland crash due to fontconfig

body: Thank you for fixing this bug! :100:

issue.title: ERROR smithay_client_toolkit::window::concept_frame No font could be found

repository.name: iced
repository.description: A cross-platform GUI library for Rust, inspired by Elm

issue.body:
_Ubuntu 20.04, Kernel 5.8.0, Wayland, Radeon HD 7730M, installed vulkan tools using [this guide](https://linuxconfig.org/install-and-test-vulkan-on-linux)_

I was first running into a bunch of font errors as mentioned [here](https://github.com/hecrj/iced/issues/386) #386, I followed the advice to install fontconfig (and libfontconfig1-dev) and those errors went away.  However one remained.  Here is the output I see when I try to `cargo run` the **tours** example.  

> WARNING: radv is not a conformant vulkan implementation, testing use only.
> [2021-04-08T18:15:59Z ERROR smithay_client_toolkit::window::concept_frame] No font could be found

I'm not sure how do deal with either line 1 or 2.  On line one, it warns about radv.  But in my grub command I've modified it to set amdgpu on and radeon support off like so:

>GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="radeon.si_support=0 radeon.cik_support=0 amdgpu.si_support=1 amdgpu.cik_support=1 amdgpu.dc=1 amdgpu.dpm=1 amdgpu.modeset=1"

For the second line of output (the "ERROR smithay_client_toolkit::window::concept_frame"), I have no idea what might fix that and nothing helpful showing up on search engines.

Any advice on how to fix this?
